abstract: Op-Ed article by author Simon Sebag Montefiore, referencing execution of Libyan dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddifi, contends death of a tyrant is always political, and reflects the character of his power; says, if a tyrant is executed while crying for mercy, that, too, is a reflection of the nature of fallen regime and the reaction of an oppressed people.
snippet: The death of a tyrant is always political, and reflects the character of his power.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: The death of a tyrant is always political, and reflects the character of his power.

headline.main: Dictators Get the Deaths They Deserve
headline.print_headline: Dictators Get The Deaths They Deserve
headline.seo: Qaddafi and the Lives of Tyrants
